result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J. Rickard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek J. Rickard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek J. Rickard was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

14CF17 & 13CF532,  Defendant Derek J. Rickard in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one without repeater in 13CF532. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 20 days jail starting October 26, 2015 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. May transfer to Dane Cty. Jail. May travel to Sauk or Dane Cty. for treatment. Electronic monitoring granted. $831 fine. Ct. 2&3 dismissed. (No jail credit)  In 14CF17, no contest plea to ct. one without repeater. Court found guilty, imposed 30 days jail, consecutive to 13CF532. Huber granted under jail rules. May transfer to Dane Cty. Jail.  Electronic monitoring granted. May travel to Sauk or Dane Cty. for treatment. $831 fine. Sixty days to pay fines or set up payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Cts. 2,3,4 dismissed. ( No jail credit)
